posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked:
You are not comparing the value returned to anything.

You need to do…  All you did is get the Boolean, but didn’t compare it to anything

if (tower.isBallHereUpper == false){ do this }

In order to enter the if command you need a condition… is ball here returns the boolean and == “is equal to” true or false based on what you need…

See our interuppted code here…

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: No, you can use booleans directly as is. A comparison operator just returns Boolean so true ==true is redundant.

posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked: Ok, that makes sense… never done it that way, but I see what you mean now there…  Guess that is what I get for thinking that I am starting to understand this whole programming thing
